main event: A brilliant meteor or satellite was observed by the chief officer and lookout of the M/V Geisha from July 8th, 1961.
interesting points: The sighting occurred over the Pacific Ocean and was reported to last for about 15 minutes., The object appeared in the bearing of 23 degrees altitude and disappeared in clouds at 30 degrees altitude., The meteor was described as being of the same brilliant white color as the star Vega., The observations were made at night under partly cloudy weather conditions., Weather conditions reported included winds from the east at force 4 and a temperature of 77Â°F.
witness description: chief officer and lookout of the M/V Geisha
